thread.title: IOS 9, Apple and Amazon living room remotes - #talkingtechLIVE

title: IOS 9, Apple and Amazon living room remotes - #talkingtechLIVE
text:
#talkingtechLIVE roundtable: from left, Donovan Janus, 17 Hats, Mikael Mossberg, Distiller, Allison Mac, Gas Buddy, host Jefferson Graham and Todd Mitchem, High There. (Photo: Ryan Grove)
6 CONNECT 20 TWEET 1 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE VENICE BEACH, Calif. - The voice is where it's at in the living room of the future.
Forget about typing in names of actors in movies, or titles of TV shows. New remotes from Amazon and Apple for streaming boxes are all about voice navigation. How will this play with consumers?
With revamped streaming boxes from Apple and Amazon set for October release, the #talkingtechLIVE roundtable tackles the future of voice search on this week's podcast.
On this week's show, we also offer a group review of the new Apple IOS 9 mobile operating system upgrade and compare notes with Reviewed.com' s TJ Donegan on the new Sony A7RII, a pricey but powerful new digital camera with a whopping 42 megapixel image sensor, 4K video recording and image stabilization. And we meet the "TInder for Tokers," app, along with the Distiller whiskey recommendation engine, talk local gas prices with GasBuddy and meet the world's first professional video game player.
Meet our #talkingtechLIVE panel.
--Allison Mac, an analyst with the Gas Buddy app, which alerts users to the cheapest gas around.
--Mikael Mossberg, the co-founder/CEO of Distiller a whiskey recommendation engine. Users activate Distiller's recommendation algorithm by answering a few questions about their tastes, experience, and context on the situation; or search for something more specific like scotch under $50.
-- Todd Mitchem, CEO of High There, the new app that's been called the "Tinder for Tokers," a social network for folks looking to light up with.
--Dennis Fong, CEO and founder of Raptr and Plays.tv, (the world's first video game pro) who once won a Ferrari in a pro esports match.
--Donovan Janus, co-founder of 17hats.com, a business management solution for businesses like photo studios, writers, designers, artists and others that are operated by solo entrepreneurs running their own micro-businesses.
From the 0917 edition of #talkingtechLIVE: our photo session after the show, with, Mikael Mossberg, Allison Mac, Donovan Janus and Todd Mitchem Jefferson Graham Fullscreen GasBuddy's Allison Mac Jefferson Graham Fullscreen Mikael Mossberg, Distiller Jefferson Graham Fullscreen Dennis Fong, Plays.TV Jefferson Graham Fullscreen Todd Mitchem, High There Jefferson Graham Fullscreen #talkingtechLIVE host Jefferson Graham Ryan Grove Fullscreen Mikael Mossberg, Allison Mac, Donovan Janus, Todd Mitchem Jefferson Graham Fullscreen Mikael Mossberg, Allison Mac, Donovan Janus, Todd Mitchem Jefferson Graham Fullscreen Donovan Janus, Mikael Mossberg, Allison Mac, Jefferson Graham and Todd Mitchem Ryan Grove Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide #talkingtechLIVE airs every Thursday at 8 p.m. ET on TuneIn, and is archived on iTunes, Stitcher, SoundCloud and TuneIn. This week, a special bonus #talkingtechLIVE will air as well Wednesday night, when we sit down with super-investor Chris Sacca at JibJab Studios in Los Angeles. The show airs at 10 p.m. ET.
